data.enText: without enough money to pay what you owe

data.chText: 那家公司经高等法院宣告破产。
data.enText: The company was declared bankrupt in the High Court.

data.chText: 完全缺乏（有价值的东西）
data.enText: completely lacking in anything that has value

data.chText: 完全缺乏新观念的政府
data.enText: a government bankrupt of new ideas
a society that is morally bankrupt
a person who has been judged by a court to be unable to pay his or her debts

data.chText: 这家公司为律师费用所累几乎破产。
data.enText: The company was almost bankrupted by legal costs.

simple_means.memory_skill: bank 银行 + rupt 破，断裂 → 银行倒闭 → 破产的

means: 完全缺乏(有价值的东西)

tr: someone who has insufficient assets to cover their debts

example: My daughter's fancy wedding is going to break me!
The slump in the financial markets smashed him

value.def: People or organizations that go bankrupt do not have enough money to pay their debts.

example.ex: If the firm cannot sell its products, it will go bankrupt...
example.tran: 如果公司的产品卖不出去，它就会倒闭。

example.ex: He was declared bankrupt after failing to pay a £114m loan guarantee.
example.tran: 由于无力偿还1.14亿英镑的贷款担保，他被宣布破产。

value.tran: 破产的；倒闭的；资不抵债的

value.def: To bankrupt a person or organization means to make them go bankrupt.

example.ex: The move to the market nearly bankrupted the firm and its director...
example.tran: 入市几乎使公司及其董事破产。

example.ex: Uninsured people can be bankrupted by big medical bills.
example.tran: 高额的医疗费会让未参保者变得倾家荡产。

value.def: A bankrupt is a person who has been declared bankrupt by a court of law.
If you say that something is bankrupt, you are emphasizing that it lacks any value or worth.

example.ex: He really thinks that European civilisation is morally bankrupt.
example.tran: 他确实认为欧洲文明道德沦丧。

partsOfSpeech.dec: ab 离去 + rupt 破，断裂 → 断开 → 突然断开 → 突然的
bank 银行 + rupt 破，断裂 → 银行倒闭 → 破产的
bankrupt 破产的 + cy 状态 → 破产
cor 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 → 破坏组织肌体 → 腐败的
cor 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion 表状态 → 腐败
dis 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 → 裂开 → 分裂
dis 加强 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion 表名词 → 分裂；瓦解
e 出 + rupt 破，断裂 → 破裂而喷出 → 爆发
e 出 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion 表名词 → 爆发
inter 在…之间 + rupt 破，断裂 → 在〔讲话〕中间打断 → 打断
inter 在…之间 + rupt 破，断裂 + ion，interrupt 的名词 → 打断；插嘴
rupt 破，断裂 + ure 表行为 → 破裂；断绝
